talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: Masking in healthcare in general. Why the hell did so many HCW decide their own lives and the lives of others meant so little they could stop masking when Covid is still killing people? I still wear a mask. I couldn't deal with knowing I was responsible for someone else's death or disability.

talk.author: did:plc:xhkwhxsjuoorrkbdz6kbtjbb
talk.utter: I feel the same as you. One way masking works but, NOT as well as if everyone wears one. They know that.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter:
I mask up every time I go shopping or anywhere crowded, I'm vaxxed & boosted, & I've still been "gifted" Covid 4 times. I live in a 73% red county in SE GA. Our vax rate has been holding steady at 34% for the last 3 years. 
I hate to think how many times I'd have been infected if I didn't mask up.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter:
I mask up every time I go shopping or anywhere crowded, I'm vaxxed & boosted, & I've still been "gifted" Covid 4 times. I live in a 73% red county in SE GA. Our vax rate has been holding steady at 34% for the last 3 years. 
I hate to think how many times I'd have been infected if I didn't mask up.

talk.author: did:plc:xhkwhxsjuoorrkbdz6kbtjbb
talk.utter: When I lived in Claxton, I used to call it "Fruitcake, Georgia." lol

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: We live in Glennville! The stupid is strong here. My daughter homeschools her kids because the schools suck -- and Covid denial would put us all at risk. I have a shit immune system and my son in law has drug resistant seizure disorder. As careful as we are, it's still not enough.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: We live in Glennville! The stupid is strong here. My daughter homeschools her kids because the schools suck -- and Covid denial would put us all at risk. I have a shit immune system and my son in law has drug resistant seizure disorder. As careful as we are, it's still not enough.

talk.author: did:plc:xhkwhxsjuoorrkbdz6kbtjbb
talk.utter: I've been to Glennville many times! I didn't live right in Claxton. More like about a mile outside of Belleville and I had family in Daisy! I worked at Wilbanks Apiaries. Lord, that was ages ago! I miss going to Jeckyl though. A lot.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter:
My daughter and her 21 year old twins work at the Food Lion in Pembroke -- used to be Harvey's. 

We go to St Simon's Island as well as Jekyll Island depending on what mood we're in.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter:
My daughter and her 21 year old twins work at the Food Lion in Pembroke -- used to be Harvey's. 

We go to St Simon's Island as well as Jekyll Island depending on what mood we're in.

talk.author: did:plc:xhkwhxsjuoorrkbdz6kbtjbb
talk.utter: When I was off work I was hot on the trail to St. Simons or Jeckyll every single chance I got. Back then you could go to Jeckyll on a weekday and have the place to. yourself all day long. THAT was amazing!

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: We like to go during the week when it's not busy.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: I'd love to be able to afford to eat like that, but it's not gonna happen.

talk.author: did:plc:vguusyto54xafo24i4htdy4k
talk.utter: I spend much less on food than I used to. But I live in CA and we have plenty of fresh produce and locally sourced food

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: It's not about availability, but price. Nobody is getting rich on Social Security Disability.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: It's not about availability, but price. Nobody is getting rich on Social Security Disability.

talk.author: did:plc:yxg64ieeij5vgrzglebkt4ol
talk.utter: This is why people need to work together to do community small scale farming.  It is possible to grow in most places if you know how. Problem is, as a society we have largely forgotten how to grow our own produce.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: We moved to GA 3 years ago. We're still trying to figure out the climate & how it affects what we grow as well as when we try to grow it. Some things do well, while others are a struggle. This year, between the insane heat, less than normal rain, & back to back hurricanes, it was pretty much shit.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: Fortunately, we're in farm country. I can drive 15 miles up the road & get veggies for dirt cheap. There are a lot of U-picks, too - berries, grapes, etc. My mom was an abusive, narcissitic bitch, but she taught me how to can veggies & make jams/jellies/etc. At least we've got that going for us.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: Our town is 73% red, and I'm not amenable to gardening with those who voted against my rights and those of my daughter and granddaughters. We'll do what we can. We're used to not having a lot. We're making the garden bigger and starting winter crops, too. (greens, etc)

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: How many fascist governors were there in the 70s and 80s? How many docs treating AIDS patients were threatened with up to 99 years in prison? None that I can remember.

talk.author: did:plc:biopwmcxye3l5r6hgk6zbeu7
talk.utter: That was not the same. Healthcare institutions chose not to see or treat on their own. The government chose to ignore.  Reagan never said the word AIDS. Those who did see AIDs patients just lost their practice if word got out.  No one wanted to be in same rooms.

talk.author: did:plc:u7kz76a7tywtmnkzodn7mlwh
talk.utter: "That wasn't the same" yet you use it as an example to insist docs need to risk their licenses and put their other patients in jeopardy rather than follow the law.......
